conclusion: Find the area S of the cylindrical surface through which light exits.
Light enters perpendicularly through the rectangular surface.
Light travels along the radius R inside the semi-cylinder.
Snell's law: n1 sin(theta1) = n2 sin(theta2).
Incident angle at the interface is theta_r where sin(theta_r) = L/R.
Refracted ray exits at angle theta' such that sin(theta') = L/4R.
Area S depends on the subtended angle phi at point O'.
Area S of the sector is calculated as pi R^2 / 2.
The area S of the cylindrical surface through which the light exits is pi R^2 / 2.
